result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth C.R. Lacapa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations
automatic expungement upon completion of probation and financial obligation.

$518.00  including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elizabeth C.R. Lacapa

records.addlTxt: 10:44 AM Defendant Elizabeth C.R. Lacapa in court, in custody.   Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Elizabeth C.R. Lacapa. Attorney Jennifer Gross  in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty         waived prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

10:44 AM Defendant Elizabeth C.R. Lacapa in court, in custody.   Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Elizabeth C.R. Lacapa. Attorney Jennifer Gross  in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  Attny Taber recites agreement.  Court moves to waiver of preliminary hearing.  State to file information exact to complaint.   Court moves to plea/sentencing.  DEF enters guilty plea.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.   Attny Taber makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF no comment.  Court addresses DEF.   

COURT:  withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Conditions of probation:  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.  Court costs, including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. If revoked.  108 days jail credit.   
Automatic expungement upon completion of probation and financial obligation.
Status conference on July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD / 1:35 PM Defendant Elizabeth C.R. LaCapa appeared by video, in custody at Barron County.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attny Taber request jury trial to be set (Case 21CF304), and filed motion for bond modification.   Attny Taber to set with JA.

State makes bond recommendation.   SIBS $2500      DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Counsel DEF waives time limints for preliminary hearing.
